place.name: LLANFAIRORLLWYN
place.gazetteerText: LLANFAIR-ORLLWYN, a parish in Newcastle-in-Emlyn district, Cardigan; on the river Teifi at the boundary with Carmarthenshire, 4 miles E by N of Newcastle-Emlyn r. station. Post town, Newcastle-Emlyn, under Carmarthen. Acres, 1,744. Real property, £1,168. Pop., 427. Houses, 93. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £155. Patron, the Bishop of St. David's. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
